page.title: 20GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: The area is dominated by extractive industry namely Creswell Colliery, a coal mine and Steetley Quarry, a limestone quarry. Most of the people who live in the area have jobs at either the coal mine or the quarry. They also dominate the landscape with their winding gear, pit tips, chimneys and buildings. In contrast to this the private grounds of Welbeck Abbey belong to another era and have remained unchanged for hundreds of years. Welbeck Estates own most of the land in the area and the majority of it is very productive farmland. Creswell is the largest settlement and is mainly brick built. Holbeck, High Holbeck and Holbeck Woodhouse are much smaller settlements with many stone buildings set amongst farmland, as picturesque as anywhere in Britain.
